projectPurpose: To provide an interactive command-line utility for searching and filtering text data, with a specific focus on handling and interacting with streaming data in real-time.
mainFeatures: Real-time processing and updating of results from streaming data
Ability to re-execute a command for processing
Archived mode for searching recent streaming data history

alternatives.name: GNU Grep
mainFeatures: Basic pattern matching using regular expressions
Search within files and standard input

alternatives.name: Ripgrep (rg)
mainFeatures: Can output results in JSON format

alternatives.name: Ack
mainFeatures: Automatically excludes certain file types and directories

alternatives.name: Logdy
mainFeatures: Tail and grep-like functionality via web UI
Can stream logs from files or process outputs

alternatives.name: Peco
mainFeatures: Integrates with pipes for filtering command output
Can be used for filtering various types of lists

marketPositioning: sig is positioned as an interactive command-line grep alternative specifically tailored for handling and searching streaming data in real-time. Unlike traditional grep, which primarily processes static files or finite streams once, sig offers a dynamic interface that allows users to refine searches on live data feeds and provides an archived mode to review recent history. This focus on interactivity with streams differentiates it from faster file searchers like ripgrep and more comprehensive, often GUI-based, log analysis platforms. It aims to provide a lightweight, command-line native solution for a common challenge in development and operations: monitoring and filtering continuous text outputs.
